title: Data cleaning
text: tinyTools renamed tinytools metID renamed metid. please uninstall install tidymass. don’t use . detach : Remove : Restart R session. errors, ignore .
code: detach("package:tinyTools") detach("package:metID") remove.packages(pkgs = "tinyTools") remove.packages(pkgs = "metID")

title: Data cleaning
text: can just use devtools remote install tidymass. Please update devtools first restart r session. install tidymass: installation, ask want update packages times, just enter enter key skip . error like : Try resolve : R console, type code: open page browser, create “New personal access token” copy .  type code: add one line like : GITHUB_PAT created step 1. restart R session try .
code: install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("tidymass/tidymass", dependencies = TRUE) Error: Failed to install 'tidymass' from GitHub: HTTP error 403. API rate limit exceeded for 171.66.10.237. (But here's the good news: Authenticated requests get a higher rate limit. Check out the documentation for more details.) usethis::create_github_token() usethis::edit_r_environ() GITHUB_PAT=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

what: Install tidymass packages one by one
title: Data cleaning
text: use windoes os dependencies can installed, try install tidymass packages one one. Let know questions.
code: devtools::install_github("tidymass/tinytools", dependencies = TRUE) devtools::install_github("tidymass/massdataset", dependencies = TRUE) devtools::install_github("tidymass/demodata", dependencies = TRUE) devtools::install_github("tidymass/massqc", dependencies = TRUE) devtools::install_github("tidymass/massprocesser", dependencies = TRUE) devtools::install_github("tidymass/masscleaner", dependencies = TRUE) devtools::install_github("tidymass/massstat", dependencies = TRUE) devtools::install_github("tidymass/metid", dependencies = TRUE) devtools::install_github("tidymass/metpath", dependencies = TRUE)

title: Data cleaning
text: Can install dependent packages raster Cario raster package CRAN, try install first install tidymass. Cario package CRAN, try install first install tidymass.
code: install.packages("raster") install.packages("Cairo")

text: Download demo data refer article.

title: Raw data processing
code: library(massprocesser) massprocesser::process_data(   path = "mzxml_ms1_data/POS",   polarity = "positive",   ppm = 10,   peakwidth = c(10, 60),   threads = 4,   output_tic = TRUE,   output_bpc = TRUE,   output_rt_correction_plot = TRUE,   min_fraction = 0.5,   group_for_figure = "QC" )

title: Raw data processing
code: massprocesser::process_data(   path = "mzxml_ms1_data/NEG",   polarity = "negative",   ppm = 10,   peakwidth = c(10, 60),   threads = 4,   output_tic = TRUE,   output_bpc = TRUE,   output_rt_correction_plot = TRUE,   min_fraction = 0.5,   group_for_figure = "QC" )

title: Authors and Citation
text: Xiaotao Shen. Author, maintainer. Hong Yan. Contributor. Chuchu Wang. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Shen X (2022). tidymass: R packages mass spectrometry data processing analysis. R package version 0.0.1.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tidymass: R packages for mass spectrometry data processing and analysis},   author = {Xiaotao Shen},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.1}, }

title: tidymass
text: tidymass collection R packages designed MS-based untargeted metabolomics data processing. packages share underlying design philosophy, grammar, data structures. Tidymass comprehensive computational framework MS-based untargeted metabolomics data processing analysis, including raw data processing (peak detecting), data cleaning (missing value processing, data normalization, integration), statistical analysis, metabolite annotation, biological function mining (pathway enrichment, feature-based metabolic module analysis).  can install tidymass GitHub. can use tidymass_install() install packages tidymass. Now, tidymass contains 9 packages, listed :   massconverter used convert mass spectrometry raw data format data (mzXML, mxML, etc.).    massdataset used organize metabolomics experiment data mass_dataset class object, can processed tidymass packages.    massprocesser used LC-MS based untargeted metabolomics raw data processing.    masscleaner used data cleaning metabolomics.    massqc used data quality assessment control.    metid used metabolite database construction metabolite annotation.    massstat used statistical analysis untargeted metabolomics.    metpath used pathway enrichment analysis metabolomics data.    masstools collection useful tiny tools mass spectrometry data processing analysis.  questions tidymass, please don’t hesitate email (shenxt@stanford.edu) reach via social medias . shenxt1990 shenxt@stanford.edu Twitter M339, Alway Buidling, Cooper Lane, Palo Alto, CA 94304 use tidymass publications, please cite publication: X. Shen, R. Wang, X. Xiong, Y. Yin, Y. Cai, Z. Ma, N. Liu, Z.-J. Zhu* (Corresponding Author), Metabolic Reaction Network-based Recursive Metabolite Annotation Untargeted Metabolomics, Nature Communications, 2019, 10: 1516.Web Link. Thank much!
code: if(!require(devtools)){ install.packages("devtools") } devtools::install_github("tidymass/tidymass") library(tidymass) tidymass::tidymass_install(from = "github", force = FALSE)

title: Conflicts between the tidymass and other packages — tidymass_conflicts

title: Conflicts between the tidymass and other packages — tidymass_conflicts
code: tidymass_conflicts()

title: Conflicts between the tidymass and other packages — tidymass_conflicts
text: four conflicts deliberately ignored: intersect, union, setequal, setdiff dplyr. functions make base equivalents generic, negatively affect existing code.

title: Conflicts between the tidymass and other packages — tidymass_conflicts
code: tidymass_conflicts() #> ── Conflicts ─────────────────────────────────────────── tidymass_conflicts() ── #> ✖ massdataset::apply()           masks base::apply() #> ✖ BiocGenerics::colMeans()       masks massdataset::colMeans(), base::colMeans() #> ✖ BiocGenerics::colSums()        masks massdataset::colSums(), base::colSums() #> ✖ dplyr::collect()               masks xcms::collect() #> ✖ S4Vectors::colnames()          masks BiocGenerics::colnames(), massdataset::colnames(), base::colnames() #> ✖ dplyr::combine()               masks MSnbase::combine(), Biobase::combine(), BiocGenerics::combine() #> ✖ dplyr::filter()                masks metpath::filter(), massdataset::filter(), stats::filter() #> ✖ dplyr::first()                 masks S4Vectors::first() #> ✖ masstools::getDP()             masks tinytools::getDP() #> ✖ masstools::get_os()            masks tinytools::get_os() #> ✖ dplyr::groups()                masks xcms::groups() #> ✖ S4Vectors::head()              masks massdataset::head(), utils::head() #> ✖ S4Vectors::intersect()         masks BiocGenerics::intersect(), massdataset::intersect(), base::intersect() #> ✖ masstools::keep_one()          masks tinytools::keep_one() #> ✖ dplyr::lag()                   masks stats::lag() #> ✖ masstools::ms2Match()          masks tinytools::ms2Match() #> ✖ masstools::ms2_plot()          masks tinytools::ms2_plot() #> ✖ masstools::mz_rt_match()       masks tinytools::mz_rt_match(), massdataset::mz_rt_match() #> ✖ masstools::name_duplicated()   masks tinytools::name_duplicated() #> ✖ masstools::read_mgf()          masks metid::read_mgf(), tinytools::read_mgf() #> ✖ masstools::removeNoise()       masks tinytools::removeNoise() #> ✖ dplyr::rename()                masks S4Vectors::rename(), massdataset::rename() #> ✖ BiocGenerics::rowMeans()       masks massdataset::rowMeans(), base::rowMeans() #> ✖ BiocGenerics::rowSums()        masks massdataset::rowSums(), base::rowSums() #> ✖ S4Vectors::rownames()          masks BiocGenerics::rownames(), massdataset::rownames(), base::rownames() #> ✖ MSnbase::scale()               masks massdataset::scale(), base::scale() #> ✖ masstools::setwd_project()     masks tinytools::setwd_project() #> ✖ masstools::split_formula()     masks tinytools::split_formula() #> ✖ S4Vectors::tail()              masks massdataset::tail(), utils::tail() #> ✖ masstools::trans_ID()          masks tinytools::trans_ID() #> ✖ masstools::trans_id_database() masks tinytools::trans_id_database()

title: List all tidymass dependencies — tidymass_deps
text: recursive TRUE, also list dependencies tidymass packages. repos repositories use check updates. Defaults getOption("repos").

title: tidymass_install — tidymass_install
text: Install packages tidymass.

title: tidymass_install — tidymass_install
code: tidymass_install(   force = FALSE,   upgrade = "never",   dependencies = NA,   demo_data = TRUE,   which_package = c("all", "massconverter", "massdataset", "massprocesser",     "masscleaner", "massqc", "metid", "massstat", "metpath", "masstools"),   ... )

title: tidymass_install — tidymass_install
text: force Force installation, even remote state changed since previous install. upgrade One "default", "ask", "always", "never". "default" respects value R_REMOTES_UPGRADE environment variable set, falls back "ask" unset. "ask" prompts user date packages upgrade. non-interactive sessions "ask" equivalent "always". TRUE FALSE also accepted correspond "always" "never" respectively. dependencies dependencies want check? Can character vector (selecting "Depends", "Imports", "LinkingTo", "Suggests", "Enhances"), logical vector.TRUE shorthand "Depends", "Imports", "LinkingTo" "Suggests". NA shorthand "Depends", "Imports" "LinkingTo" default. FALSE shorthand dependencies (.e. just check package, dependencies). value "soft" means TRUE, "hard" means NA. demo_data Install demo_data package . which_package packages want install? Default . can set character vector. ... parameters devtools::install_github() devtools::install_git()
